resources.string: This app will use your device\'s stored data and sensors to deliver you a personalised podcast experience

BBC is trialling a new podcast programme app, which is offered to you by Media AT.


BBC will not collect any personal data and will only use anonymised data. The app is based on perceptive media and object based media technology.


Please note that this app is experimental and may not meet the usual BBC technical standards.


The app does require the following Android permissions to operate correctly 
	• Contacts 
	• Location 
	• Storage


We take your privacy very seriously, please take a look at our information privacy policy for more details.

The content in the app is designed for people 16 and over and may not be suitable for people under 16.


We encourage audience feedback. You are able to give feedback during the trial period using the app's Taster page with the "Rate" feature or by contacting us at taster@bbc.co.uk. The "Rate" and "Share" features help the BBC create new ideas of interest to our audiences.


The app does not necessarily represent the BBC's future plans. Some ideas may only be available during the trial period and the BBC may choose to commission alternative ideas and content.


You can listen to the programmes on Android 8.0 (Oreo) device or higher.


Â© BBC 2022

The app is designed as an experimental platform for a new type of podcast.


The RSS Feed URL preferences enables creators to experiment with creating their own using a combination of object based media and the W3C SMIL (Synchronised Multimedia Integration Language) Specification.


If any changes do not work, you can reset the application by using the perceptive podcast app info option. Then clear the storage to start it as you first installed it.


More details can be found on the MakerBox page and blog post.
